title: Munnar Tea Gardens
short_description: Endless rolling hills carpeted with emerald green tea plantations in the Western Ghats.
long_description: Munnar is a town in the Western Ghats mountain range in India’s Kerala state. It is synonymous with rolling hills that are carpeted with emerald-green tea plantations, contoured, clipped and sculpted like ornamental hedges. The low mountain scenery is magnificent and you’re often up above the clouds watching veils of mist clinging to the mountaintops. Munnar is also famous for the Neelakurinji flowers, which bloom once every 12 years and turn the hills blue.
wildlife_significance: Habitat for Nilgiri Tahr and Nilgiri Wood Pigeon. Neelakurinji phenomenon.
guides_and_tips: Leeches can be present in bushes. Respect estate boundaries; do not trespass.
how_to_reach: By Air: Kochi (110 km). By Road: Scenic drive from Kochi or Madurai.
permits_and_fees: Museum entry fee. Jeep safari costs vary.
conservation_notes: Landslides are a risk in heavy monsoon. Sustainable tourism is encouraged.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive. Visit Tea Museum. Sunset at Pothamedu. Day 2: Jeep trek to Kolukkumalai (highest tea estate). Afternoon Mattupetty Dam. Day 3: Departure.
safety_tips: Roads are winding; motion sickness meds recommended.

operating_season.season_notes: Monsoon makes the hills incredibly green but travel can be tricky.
